body: Scope: identity resolution + config schema + metadata detection.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: Identity & Config
body: Scope: identity resolution + config schema + metadata detection.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: Formula & Templates
body: Scope: formula naming, template rendering, validation, multi-bin behavior.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: Release & Artifacts
body: Scope: release discovery, asset selection, checksums, idempotency, git flow.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: Host & API
body: Scope: GitHub API tap creation + host abstraction trait.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: UX & Safety
body: Scope: prompt flows, preview/confirm UX, error strategy, atomic writes.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: EPIC: Testing & Docs
body: Scope: testing matrix + documentation outputs.\nDoD: Epics only; child tasks define acceptance criteria.

title: Define repo identity model (CLI/tap/artifact)
body:
DoD:
- Mapping table (identity -> config fields + flags).
- Precedence rules (flags > config > autodetect > prompts).
- Examples: single-repo + split-repo.
Notes: PRD A1 (status: in_progress).

title: Specify tap repo path resolution + auto-clone
body:
DoD:
- Default path rules + temp dir naming.
- Auto-clone behavior when tap remote is known.
- Cleanup behavior and required config/flags.
Notes: PRD A1b (status: in_progress).

title: Define git remote selection + ambiguity rules
body:
DoD:
- Remote selection order for CLI/tap/artifact repos.
- Non-interactive failure behavior.
- Exact error messages.
Notes: PRD A1c (status: open).

title: Lock .distill/config.toml schema + example
body:
DoD:
- Schema doc + minimal example.
- Migration rules for unknown fields.
Notes: PRD A2 (status: in_progress).

title: Finalize non-interactive contract per command
body:
DoD:
- Final table of required fields per command.
- Autodetect sources per field.
- Exact error text + exit codes.
Notes: PRD A3 (status: in_progress).

title: Specify --import-formula merge/overwrite policy
body:
DoD:
- Field-level merge table (formula wins for formula fields).
- Explicit overwrite prompts.
- Non-interactive overwrite policy.
Notes: PRD A4 (status: in_progress).

title: Define Rust-first metadata detection
body:
DoD:
- Cargo.toml parsing rules.
- Bin target detection + defaults.
- License/homepage fallback rules.
- Edge cases: workspace, multi-bin, missing fields.
Notes: PRD A5 (status: open).

title: Define non-Rust metadata detection presets
body:
DoD:
- Manifest list (Node/Go/Python/etc).
- Field mapping + bin detection table.
- Conflict resolution rules + required prompts.
Notes: PRD A5b (status: open).

title: Specify formula naming + class normalization
body:
DoD:
- Transformation rules + validation.
- At least 8 examples (acronyms, digits, dashes, underscores).
Notes: PRD B6 (status: open).

title: Define formula template(s) + validation
body:
DoD:
- Default template + override contract.
- Validation checks list.
- Ruby output examples (single/multi-bin, universal/per-target).
Notes: PRD B7 (status: open).

title: Define multi-binary support capture
body:
DoD:
- Prompt flow sketch for multiple bins.
- Config schema impact.
Notes: PRD B8 (status: in_progress).

title: Define formula version handling rules
body: DoD:\n- Examples + validation rules for explicit version stanza.\nNotes: PRD B9 (status: in_progress).

title: Specify asset selection rules + OS/arch normalization
body:
DoD:
- Matching algorithm with asset_name/asset_template precedence.
- OS/arch normalization table.
- Failure message examples.
Notes: PRD C10 (status: open).

title: Define release discovery policy (GitHub Release)
body:
DoD:
- Rules for drafts/prereleases/latest selection.
- Examples.
- Exact error messages for missing releases/assets.
Notes: PRD C10b (status: in_progress).

title: Scope version update strategies + workspace rules
body:
DoD:
- Mode definitions (none/cargo/regex).
- Config schema additions.
- Examples incl. Cargo workspace policy + regex update.
Notes: PRD C10c (status: in_progress).

title: Specify cross-platform asset config + formula output
body:
DoD:
- Config schema impact + validation rules.
- Formula output examples for universal/per-OS/per-OS+arch.
Notes: PRD C10d (status: in_progress).

title: Define checksum acquisition strategy
body:
DoD:
- Algorithm + size/time limits.
- Retry/backoff policy.
- Error messages for download/verify failures.
Notes: PRD C10e (status: in_progress).

title: Define version/tag precedence + validation
body:
DoD:
- Precedence rules + examples.
- Semver validation (prerelease/build allowed).
- Exit code mapping for mismatches.
Notes: PRD C10f (status: in_progress).

title: Design release orchestration + idempotency
body:
DoD:
- Step-by-step flow + idempotency matrix.
- Dry-run output sample.
- Exact error messages/exit codes for common failures.
Notes: PRD C11 (status: open).

title: Decide git integration approach
body:
DoD:
- Decision rationale (libgit2 vs shell).
- Remote selection rules + error code mapping.
Notes: PRD C12 (status: open).

title: Specify GitHub API tap creation flow
body:
DoD:
- Required scopes list.
- API flow steps/diagram.
- Fallback behavior when token missing.
Notes: PRD D13 (status: open).

title: Define host abstraction trait
body:
DoD:
- Trait/interface shape + required methods.
- Versioning plan for future providers.
Notes: PRD D14 (status: open).

title: Design bd init prompt flow + mapping
body:
DoD:
- Prompt sequence + field defaults.
- Preview examples + overwrite decision points.
- --yes/--force semantics + brew tap-new fallback behavior.
Notes: PRD E15 (status: open).

title: Define bd doctor checks + audit modes
body: DoD:\n- Validation checklist + mapping to exit codes.\nNotes: PRD E16 (status: open).

title: Define error strategy + exit codes/messages
body: DoD:\n- Error catalog with exact messages + exit codes.\nNotes: PRD E17 (status: open).

title: Define preview/confirm UX + atomic writes
body:
DoD:
- Atomic write + rollback spec.
- Temp file strategy.
Notes: PRD E18 (status: open).

title: Specify preview/diff output for multi-repo changes
body:
DoD:
- Diff format examples + ordering rules.
- Dry-run output contract.
Notes: PRD E18b (status: open).

title: Plan testing matrix
body:
DoD:
- Test matrix table (init/release/doctor).
- Minimal harness outline.
Notes: PRD F19 (status: open).

title: Define documentation outputs
body: DoD:\n- Docs list + owner/source (generated vs hand-written).\nNotes: PRD F20 (status: open).

title: EPIC: Decisions locked (v0)
body: Scope: capture PRD decisions already finalized so planning is complete.\nDoD: closed tasks exist for each locked decision in PRD.

title: Document tap layout enforcement + tap-new rules
body: PRD closed item #21: tap layout enforcement (separate tap repo only), creation flow (brew tap-new vs manual), detection rules.

title: Document release artifact default + source tarball strategy
body: PRD closed item #22: default release assets; source tarball is explicit strategy (no implicit fallback).

title: Document cross-platform asset decision
body: PRD closed item #23: per-OS/arch sections supported; universal asset allowed.

title: Document checksum policy decision
body: PRD closed item #24: download asset and compute SHA256 locally; ignore checksum assets in v0.

title: Document version/tag normalization decision
body: PRD closed item #25: normalize leading v in tags; formula version uses normalized string.

title: EPIC: CLI Core
body: Foundation implementation tasks for the Rust CLI (arg parsing, shared context, error handling).

title: EPIC: Init Workflow
body: Implementation tasks for bd init interactive and non-interactive flows, tap setup, and formula bootstrap.

title: Implement Rust CLI scaffold (init/release/ship/doctor)
body:
Acceptance:
- clap app defines subcommands and shared/global flags per PRD
- shared app context wires config loading + repo detection
- errors map to exit codes via central enum

title: Implement config IO + validation for .distill/config.toml
body:
Acceptance:
- load/save config with atomic writes and temp files
- resolve config path under .distill/ with override flag support
- enforce schema defaults and surface missing required fields

title: Implement preview/diff engine for multi-repo writes
body:
Acceptance:
- generates unified diff for changed files before write/commit
- lists target repos and files to be modified
- supports --dry-run with no filesystem writes

title: Implement bd init interactive flow (detect, prompt, preview, write)
body:
Acceptance:
- detects metadata from manifests + git remote
- prompts for missing fields and shows defaults
- previews config/formula writes and confirms before applying

title: Implement bd init --non-interactive validation + overwrite guards
body:
Acceptance:
- enforces required fields (config/flags) when non-interactive
- respects --force/--yes for overwrite and exits with clear error otherwise
- no partial writes on validation failure

title: Implement bd init tap repo handling (path, auto-clone, brew tap-new)
body:
Acceptance:
- resolves tap path rules and auto-clones when needed
- supports optional brew tap-new scaffold (flagged)
- errors when brew missing/offline with actionable message

title: Implement bd init --import-formula merge path
body:
Acceptance:
- reads existing Formula/*.rb and extracts fields per merge policy
- config fills gaps only; formula remains source-of-truth
- non-interactive mode refuses overwrite without --force

title: Implement bd release pipeline (discovery, assets, formula update)
body:
Acceptance:
- discovers GitHub release per configured tag/version rules
- selects assets per OS/arch config + overrides
- updates formula URL/SHA/version and writes preview

title: Implement release idempotency + git commit/tag/push flow
body:
Acceptance:
- detects formula already at target version and requires --force to reapply
- commits and tags per config with --no-push support
- handles existing tag/release per idempotency rules

title: Implement formula template rendering (multi-bin + per-OS/arch)
body:
Acceptance:
- renders Formula/<name>.rb from config + metadata
- supports multi-bin installs and per-OS/arch asset blocks
- validates output against template rules before writing

title: Implement metadata detection (Rust + Node/Go/Python presets)
body:
Acceptance:
- detects name/desc/version/bin/license/homepage from supported manifests
- handles conflicts with prompts or non-interactive errors
- falls back to git remote + prompts when no manifest

title: Implement GitHub host client (release discovery, assets, tap creation)
body:
Acceptance:
- uses GitHub API for releases and tap repo creation
- supports authenticated token via env and handles rate/permission errors
- provides download helpers for checksum acquisition

title: Implement bd doctor checks + optional brew audit
body:
Acceptance:
- validates config completeness, formula consistency, repo state
- runs brew audit only when requested and reports actionable output
- exits with defined error code on failures

title: Implement automated tests for init/release/doctor flows
body:
Acceptance:
- unit tests for config + template rendering
- integration tests cover init/release happy paths with fixtures
- CI-friendly tests avoid network via mocks

title: Write CLI docs + examples (init/release/doctor)
body:
Acceptance:
- README or docs cover quickstart and non-interactive examples
- includes config.toml sample and formula output snippet
- documents exit codes and common error messages

title: Implement version/tag normalization helper
body:
Acceptance:
- resolves --version/--tag inputs with v-prefix normalization
- rejects non-semver values with clear invalid input errors
- errors on mismatched version/tag inputs
- unit tests cover common and error cases

title: Write README with install + early usage
Write README with install + early usage instructions for brewdistillery
body: Scope: add README content covering local build/install (cargo install --path . / cargo run), basic usage for bd init/release/doctor, and how to uninstall. Include note that Homebrew install is not yet available. DoD: README.md updated with step-by-step commands and prerequisites.

title: Write README early-build install + usage instructions
Implement release asset selection helper
body: Build asset selection utility for release assets: exact name, template rendering, OS/arch matching, checksum exclusion, and deterministic tie-breaking with tests.

title: Improve metadata detection conflicts + git remote fallback
body:
Acceptance:
- Detect multiple manifests and error on conflicting fields (name/version/license/homepage/bin).
- Use Git remote (origin preferred) to infer name/homepage when missing or no manifests.
- Normalize scoped package.json names to unscoped for project name + bin default.
Notes: aligns with PRD metadata detection requirements.

title: Update README with install + usage for early builds
body: Add or refine README instructions so users can build, install, and run the CLI before Homebrew distribution. Include: prerequisites, build from source, cargo install path, run without install, uninstall, quick start commands, and a note that Homebrew install is not available yet. Keep it concise and testable.

title: Write README install/usage for early builds
Implement bd init non-interactive formula scaffold

comment: Implemented non-interactive init formula scaffold with placeholder URL/SHA, version validation, and overwrite guard; added tests.
Requested in USER_FEEDBACK: add README with install + usage for early testing.

title: Lock config schema for .distill/config.toml
body: DoD: schema doc + minimal example + migration rules for unknown fields; list fields/defaults + precedence (flags > config > autodetect > prompts).

title: Define non-interactive contract (init/release/doctor)
body: DoD: final required-fields table per command, autodetect sources, exact error text + exit codes for missing/ambiguous inputs.

title: Specify formula naming + class normalization rules
body: DoD: transformation rules + at least 8 examples (acronyms, digits, dashes/underscores) + validation rules + error wording.

title: Define repo metadata detection (Cargo + git fallbacks)
body: DoD: edge-case examples (workspaces, multi-bin, missing license/homepage), conflict resolution rules, and required prompts.

title: Define non-Rust metadata detection presets
body: DoD: manifest list, field mapping table (Node/Go/Python), bin detection rules, conflict resolution, required prompts.

title: Write README install/usage instructions for early testing
body: User request: add README instructions for installing and running brewdistillery early builds (non-Homebrew). Include build/run steps, prerequisites, and example commands.

title: Implement formula install_block override
body:
Acceptance:
- Allow config.template.install_block to override default bin.install rendering.
- Validate that override is non-empty and properly indented in rendered formula.
- Add tests covering single-bin default and overridden install block.

comment: Implemented install_block override in formula rendering + init integration; added validation and tests.

title: Implement GitHub release discovery + asset listing
body:
Acceptance:
- fetches releases via GitHub API using config.host.api_base defaulting to https://api.github.com
- supports latest stable release selection and tag lookup
- filters draft releases and optionally prereleases
- exposes asset name + download URL list for release

title: Implement GitHub asset download + SHA256 helper
body:
Acceptance:
- downloads a release asset URL with optional size limit
- computes SHA256 locally
- returns clear Network errors on non-2xx or size limit exceeded
- supports auth token header when provided

title: Implement GitHub tap repo creation flow
body:
Acceptance:
- creates a public repo via GitHub API for user or org owner
- reads token from env (GITHUB_TOKEN or GH_TOKEN)
- handles permission and rate-limit errors with actionable messages
- returns created repo clone URL

title: Add README install + usage instructions for early builds
body:
Acceptance:
- README explains how to build/install the CLI before Homebrew release
- includes quickstart usage examples for bd init/release/doctor
- notes current limitations for early testing

title: Implement bd release auto-clone when tap.path missing
Add README install/usage instructions for early builds
Implement git remote selection + ambiguity handling
body: Update repo detection to follow docs/git-remotes.md (origin if GitHub, else single GitHub remote; ambiguous/no remote errors in non-interactive). Add tests for ambiguity + unparsable GitHub URLs.

comment: Implemented tap repo handling for init: brew tap-new path resolution, remote auto-clone to default or specified path, and error messaging for missing brew/non-git paths; added tests for remote parsing/path derivation.

title: Write README installation + early usage instructions
Write README with install + usage for early testing

DoD:
- README includes: build from source (cargo), basic usage examples for bd init/release/doctor, and note that Homebrew install is not yet available.

- Uses repo-local commands and relative paths.

title: Implement interactive --import-formula flow in bd init
Update README with early-build install/testing notes
Document early install/run steps in README
body:
Acceptance:
- README includes explicit early install steps (cargo install/build/run)
- Note binary name is 'bd' and PATH guidance
- Mention optional Homebrew requirement for audit/tap-new

title: Write README install + usage guidance for early builds
body: Document how to install the CLI before Homebrew support and how to run basic commands for testing.

title: Infer GitHub owner/repo for non-interactive init
body:
Acceptance:
- When --non-interactive init lacks --host-owner/--host-repo and config values, infer from detected GitHub homepage/remote when possible.
- Falls back to existing missing-field error if inference fails.
- Add regression test covering inference.

title: Write README install + early usage instructions
body: Add README guidance for installing brewdistillery from source and using the early CLI (bd init/release/doctor). Include requirements, local install steps, and smoke-test commands. This supports early testing before Homebrew distribution.

title: Write README install/build instructions for early testing
body: Add a user-facing README.md section with local build/install/run steps (non-Homebrew), including prerequisites and example commands for running bd from source.

title: Write README install + usage for brewdistillery
Add README install + usage instructions for early testing
body: Add README section covering how to build/install the brewdistillery CLI locally (cargo install/run), basic usage examples, and any required deps so early testers can try the tool before Homebrew packaging.

title: Default artifact strategy during init
body:
Acceptance:
- When bd init writes config and no artifact.strategy provided, default to release-asset.
- Existing config value is preserved when set.
- Add regression test for non-interactive init default.

title: Default artifact strategy during init
body:
Acceptance:
- When bd init writes config and no artifact.strategy provided, default to release-asset.
- Existing config value is preserved when set.
- Add regression test for non-interactive init default.

Acceptance:
- Support artifact.strategy="source-tarball" in bd release.
- Compute tarball URL from release.tarball_url_template (placeholders: {owner}, {repo}, {tag}, {version}) or default to GitHub refs/tags URL.
- Compute SHA256 via existing download helper; honor --dry-run.
- Require/derive tag + version; if missing, fall back to latest GitHub Release tag.
- Reject asset_name/asset_template/targets when using source-tarball with clear error.

title: Implement version_update modes in bd release
